definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to scald/to burn (by scalding)/to blanch (cooking)/to heat (sth) up in hot water/to perm/to iron/scalding hot

sentences.english: I have had burning or pain when I urinates.
sentences.chinese: 我小便時感到發燙和疼痛。

sentences.english: Your skin is pale, but you're hot all over.
sentences.chinese: 你臉色蒼白，但是你全身發燙。

sentences.english: Palm trees and pillared arcades cast shadows over the burning pavements.
sentences.chinese: 棕櫚樹和圓柱連環拱廊的陰影投在發燙的人行道上。

sentences.english: When he managed to create his own spaces, Kobe was likewise dropping bombs.
sentences.chinese: 當他可以爲自己找到投籃空間時，科比的手熱得發燙。
臉紅，臉頰發燙，手心出汗。

sentences.english: The nurse mopped his fevered brow.
sentences.chinese: 護士擦拭了他發燙的前額。

sentences.english: Her forehead was flushed with fever.
sentences.chinese: 她的前額由於發燒而發燙。

sentences.english: The hot dry earth drank up the rain.
sentences.chinese: 乾旱發燙的土地把雨水全吸光了。

sentences.english: The passionate river is going endlessly.
Tongs and Shovels are available to handle hot parts and Trays.
sentences.chinese: 鉗和鐵鍬可應用於發燙的零件和托盤。

sentences.english: Their faces burned in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 他們的臉被風吹得發燙。

sentences.english: The red-hot junk bond market is also attracting heavy investor interest.
sentences.chinese: 熱的發燙的垃圾債券市場也吸引到鉅額投資者的興趣。

definition: to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
to twitch/to throb/a spasm/to extract and use
lit. doesn't hurt, doesn't tickle (idiom); sth is wrong, but not quite sure what/fig. not getting to any matter of substance/scratching the surface/superficial/perfunctory
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
lit. to drive a lightweight chariot on a familiar road (idiom)/fig. to do sth routinely and with ease/a walk in the park
